article.title: Computer-Produced Micro-Library Catalog
article.author: Kozumplik, W.A.Lange, R.T.
article.text: The philosophy, production, and cost-effectiveness of a computer-generated library catalog is described. This catalog is unique in that it utilizes direct computer to microfilm composition techniques, employing the Stromberg Carlson 4020. Cost, user acceptance, and by-product capabilities are stressed.
